info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 30 at 5:28PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Robeson and central Dillon Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 526 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Purvis, or 12 miles northeast of Dillon, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and frequent to continuous cloud to ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar and Satellite indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Lightning strikes may cause power outages. Locations impacted include... Lumberton, Dillon, Pembroke, Fairmont, Rowland, Hamer, South Of The Border, Robeson Community College, Barker Ten Mile, Purvis, Little Rock, Elrod, Mcdonald, Raynham, Mcleod Medical Center and Southeastern Regional Medical Center. This includes the following highways... Interstate 95 in South Carolina between mile markers 189 and 198. Interstate 95 in North Carolina between mile markers 1 and 23. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
